Detailed Description

Parses HTTP-requests and calls handleHttpRequest.

void HttpParserThread::encodeBody (  MC2String &  body,
HttpHeader *  inHead,
HttpHeader *  outHead,
HttpBody *  outBody,
uint32 &  bodyLength
)  [static, private]
 

Checks the Accept-Encoding in inHead and applies supported encodings.

Currently gzip (alias x-gzip) and deflate is supported.

Parameters:
body The body might be encoded.
inHead The request's header.
outHead The reply's header.
outBody The reply body, binary flag is set if body is compressed.
bodyLength Set to the actual length of the body, not changed if body not changed.

virtual const char* HttpParserThread::getServerType (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Get a string that describes the type of server.

E.g. this method coule return "XML" (the XMLParserThread) or "MS" (MapCentralParserThread).

Returns:
A string that describes the server that does the debiting.

Implements ParserThread.

Reimplemented in XMLParserThread.

bool HttpParserThread::handleEchoRequest (  HttpHeader *  inHead,
HttpBody *  inBody,
stringMap *  paramsMap,
HttpHeader *  outHead,
HttpBody *  outBody,
uint32  now
)  [private]
 

Echos the request data in reply.

Parameters:
inHead The incoming header.
inBody The incoming body.

outHead The outgoing header.
outBody The outgoing body.
now Current time.
Returns:
True if the special file was handled.

virtual bool HttpParserThread::handleHttpRequest (  HttpHeader *  inHead,
HttpBody *  inBody,
stringMap *  paramsMap,
HttpHeader *  outHead,
HttpBody *  outBody,
uint32  now,
const char *  dateStr
)  [virtual]
 

This function is called when a new HTTP request has been received.

The possible parameters in inBody is not added to paramsMap, make a parseParameters( inBody->getBody(), paramsMap, inHead ); call if there are parameters in the body to add. The Content-Type in the outHead is set to the mime-type of the fileexternsion of the pagename. This can be called recursively by HttpFunction handlers.

Parameters:
inHead The HTTP header of the request.
inBody The body content, may be empty, of the HTTP request.
paramsMap The startline's parameters.
outHead The HTTP header of the reply.
outBody The content of the reply.
now The time of the request.
dateStr The time of the request as a string.
Returns:
True if the request was handled and outBody was filled with the reply.

Reimplemented in XMLParserThread.

This function is called when a InterfaceRequest has been received.

HttpHeader *  inHead,
HttpBody *  inBody,
stringMap *  paramsMap,
HttpHeader *  outHead,
HttpBody *  outBody
)  [private]

Skips , where ... is any string.

Parameters:

outHead The HTTP header of the reply.
outBody The content of the reply.
Returns:
True if parsing and function calls where ok, false if not.

void HttpParserThread::setBodyCharset (  HttpBody &  outBody,
MC2String &  body,
HttpHeader *  inHead,
HttpHeader *  outHead,
uint32 &  bodyLength
)  [static, private]
 

Checks the Accept-Charset in inHead and tries to use one of the charsets in it.

Sets the used Charset in outHead's Content-Type. Currently ISO-8859-1 and UTF-8 is supported.

If charSetMayBeChanged returns false for the outBody the character set will not be changed and getCharSet will be added to the outgoing header.

Parameters:
outBody The complete body.
body The body in ISO-8859-1 might be changed to another charset.
inHead The request's header.
outHead The reply's header.
bodyLength Set to the actual length of the body, not changed if body not changed.

void HttpParserThread::setCacheHeaders (  HttpHeader *  outHead,
const MC2String &  command,
bool  generatedPage,
bool  cacheElement,
uint32  date,
const char *  dateStr,
struct stat *  fStat
)  [private]
 

Sets the cache variables in the outheader to the appropriate values.

Parameters:
outHead The header of the reply.
command The HTTP command in the HTTP request.
generatedPage If the page contained functions.
cacheElement If the reply is from a cacheElement.
date The date of the HTTP reply.
dateStr The date of the HTTP reply formated in a string.
fStat The file status struct.
